intro: Heracleum pubescens var. wilhelmsii, commonly known as the Wilhelmsii hogweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbrella-shaped inflorescences and hollow stems. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves with a pubescent surface, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its toxic sap, it can be harmful to humans and animals if ingested or contacted.
